author: Andrew Bardsley
title: Live sentencing: Yobs who racially abused 'Super Juan' on Manchester tram in court
text:
Juan Jasso, the victim of the alleged racist attack on the tram in Manchester city centre Share 
Two yobs who racially abused a US Army veteran on a Metrolink tram are due to be sentenced this morning. 
Aaron Cauchi, 19, and Robert Molloy, 20, will appear at Manchester magistrates court this morning after pleading guilty yesterday on the morning of a scheduled trial. 
A third defendant, a 16-year-old from Pendleton, was yesterday sentenced to a a six month referral order after appearing at youth court. 
Juan Jasso was on a busy rush hour tram in the city centre when the incident unfolded, at about 7.40am on June 28 last year. 
During the shocking incident, which happened five days after the UK’s vote to leave the European Union, the sports lecturer from Texas was told to “get back to Africa”. Robert Molloy, left and Aaron Cauchi 
Cauchi and Molloy are also due to be sentenced for two subsequent incidents, in which they behaved in an intimidating manner towards passerby Alistair Lambert. 
One or more of the group then spat at cyclist Andrew Guest. 
Cauchi, of Spa Crescent, Little Hulton, admitted two counts of using threatening words and behaviour and one count of assault, and a further two counts of assault for an incident later that day. 
Molloy, of no fixed abode, admitted one count of assault, one of using threatening words and behaviour and another of racially aggravated assault. Share
